title: Best Way to Sell a Wine Collection
metaTitle: Best Way to Sell a Wine Collection: Comparison Guide | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Comparing the top ways to sell a wine collection: Direct Sale vs Auction vs Consignment. Pros, cons, fees, and timelines explained.
summary: A practical comparison of direct purchase, consignment, and auction with clear tradeoffs.

sections.heading: Quick Answer
content: The 'best' way depends on your priority: Speed, Price, or Effort.
list: Maximize Speed & Certainty? Choose Direct Sale (Proof Cellars).
Maximize Potential Price (with risk)? Choose Live Auction.
Maximize Effort/Risk? Sell it yourself (not recommended due to legal issues).

sections.heading: Option 1: Direct Sale (Fastest)
content: You sell the entire collection to a dealer/retailer for a set price.
list: Pros: Immediate payment, guaranteed price, flexible pickup, they take everything (even lower value items).
Cons: Trade price is wholesale (below retail).
Best for: Estates, downsizing, divorce, or anyone wanting a clean break.

sections.heading: Option 2: Auction (Highest Variance)
content: You consign to an auction house. They sell it for you and take a cut.
list: Pros: Potential for bidding wars on rare items.
Cons: 20%+ seller's commission, 3-6 month wait, 'buy-ins' (unsold lots returned to you), high rejection rate for average bottles.
Best for: Ultra-rare 'Unicorn' bottles (e.g., 1945 DRC) where price potential is unlimited.

sections.heading: Option 3: DIY (Riskiest)
content: Selling to friends or online forums.
list: Cons: Illegal in most states (liquor license required), highly prone to scams, dangerous to meet strangers.
Best for: Gifts to friends (not sales).

sections.heading: Comparison Chart
list: Direct Sale: Payment in Days | 0-15% Fee (implied) | Low Effort
Auction: Payment in Months | 15-25% Fee | High Effort
Consignment: Payment when sold | 20-30% Fee | Medium Effort

sections.heading: What to Do Next
list: If you need funds in < 30 days: Get a Direct Offer.
If you can wait 6 months: Contact an Auction House for an estimate.

faqs.question: Is consignment better than selling?
faqs.answer: Only if the market rises. If the market drops while you wait, you lose money.

faqs.question: Do I have to pay for shipping?
faqs.answer: With us, no. Auctions often charge you for pickup.

faqs.question: What if bottles don't sell?
faqs.answer: In Direct Sale, that's our problem. In Auction, they send them back to you.

faqs.question: Can I do both?
faqs.answer: You can sell the 'core' to us and auction the 'super-stars', but splitting a collection often lowers the overall offer.

faqs.question: Are your offers fair?
faqs.answer: Yes, we base them on current data minus a margin for operation. It is a wholesale offer.
